text: The University of Salford is a public research university in Salford. It is about 1 mile (1.6 kilometres) west of Manchester city centre. The Royal Technical Institute, Salford opened in 1896. It became a College of Advanced Technology in 1956 and turned into a university 1967. It has 21,500 students and is in 160 acres (65 hectares) of parkland on the banks of the River Irwell. == Other websites == * University of Salford â€“ official website Category:1896 establishments in England Category:Buildings and structures in Greater Manchester
title: University of Salford
